abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile tells us about a
            fiscal turnaround in Brazil's state of Rio Grande do
            Sul. It had a long history of fiscal mismanagement.
            Excessive expenditures and generosity in granting tax
            exemptions produced budget deficits over many years until
            2006. The state was failing to comply with Brazilian fiscal
            responsibility legislation, and its troubled fiscal
            situation had translated into deteriorated public services,
            and poor economic performance. An International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) loan was designed to
            support the state government’s effort to turn around the
            fiscal situation in the state. It supported the state with a
            two-tranche development policy loan (DPL). IBRD used its
            supervision resources to provide technical assistance to the
            state, helping the government to achieve the proposed
            results. Its innovative and tailor-made repayment profile
            was key to smoothing the highly volatile debt repayment
            profile of the state, and to secure the approval of, and a
            guarantee, from the federal government. Drawing upon IBRD
            financial and technical support, Rio Grande do Sul
            restructured its debt, generating savings of 379 million
            dollars up to December 2010. The state government was able
            to turn its finances around from a negative operating
            balance to a positive figure of 1,497 million dollars and
            increased investments.
